message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with the problem of large-scale image-based localization, which is a core problem in computer vision. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper proposes a novel representation learning method that maximizes similarities among intra-place images while minimizing similarities among inter-place images, which involves learning a probability distribution on L_2-metric distances between intra-place and inter-place image representations. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper involves experiments on standard benchmarks, which suggests that it may also belong to the sub-categories of cs.MM (Multimedia) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
